com.ibm.xasdi_bridge.simulator

Interface Launcher


  • public interface Launcher
    Interface for a simulation launcher that is to be registered as a startup hook of the runtime configuration. If Caribbean is used as the runtime for the simulation, this class should be specified to the class name of a startup service entry.
    Author:
    yamamoto

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MessageRepository getMessageRepository()
      Get message repository binding this interface.
      Region getRegion()
      Get Region object binding this interface.
      void prepare(java.util.Properties prop)
      Initialize the system using the specified properties.
      void start(java.util.Properties prop)
      Called when the simulation should be started.

    • Method Detail

      • prepare

        void prepare(java.util.Properties prop)
        Initialize the system using the specified properties. In most cases, an initialization will need to perform the following things.
        1. Define the log formats
        2. Create regions ant add them to the World object. To create a region,
          1. Add citizen proxy factories to the region (see CitizenProxyFactory)
          2. Create places and simulation drivers and add them to the region (see Place, and Driver)
        3. Initialize environments (citizen containers). To initialize an environment,
          1. Add citizen factories to the environment (see com.ibm.xasdi_bridge.citizen.Environment#addCitizenFactory)
          2. Set message resolvers if needed (see com.ibm.xasdi_bridge.citizen.Environment#setMessageResolver)
          3. Set environement listeners if needed (see com.ibm.xasdi_bridge.citizen.Environment#setEnvironmentListener)
        4. Set the initial simulation time (see World.setSimulationTime(long, long))
        Parameters:
        prop - properties specified in the runtime configuration

      • start

        void start(java.util.Properties prop)
        Called when the simulation should be started. In most cases, this method can be implemented as below.

        try {
            World.world().start();
        } catch(Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        Parameters:
        prop - properties specified in the runtime configuration
        See Also:
        World.start()

      • getRegion

        Region getRegion()
        Get Region object binding this interface.
        Returns:
        Created main Region object.

      • getMessageRepository

        MessageRepository getMessageRepository()
        Get message repository binding this interface.
        Returns:
        Created MessageRepository object.
